title: Error 'function (e) {switch(arguments.length){case 1....' upon sending 'Request ETH' from Wallet
body:
*Type*: Bug


*Summary*: The `function (e) {switch(arguments.length){case 1:return cljs.core.dissoc.cljs$core$IFn$_invoke$arity$1(arguments[0]);case 2:return cljs.core.dissoc.cljs$core$IFn$_invoke$arity$2(arguments[0],arguments[1]);default:for(var c=[],r=arguments.length,s=0;s<r;)c.push(arguments[s]),s+=1;return c=new cljs.core.IndexedSeq(c.slice(2),0,null),cljs.core.dissoc.cljs$core$IFn$_invoke$arity$variadic(arguments[0],arguments[1],c)}} is not ISeqable
` error appears after user tap on 'Send request' in order to send transaction request from Wallet to any of the contact from the list of recipients. 
Then, if I try to navigate to 1-1 chat with the contact I attempted to send a request - the same error above appears and no way to reach 1-1 chat with this particular contact.

#### Expected behavior
Transaction request is sent in 1-1 chat to the contact I requested ETH from Wallet.
#### Actual behavior
Error appears after user tap on 'Send request' from Wallet in order to send transaction request 
![screenshot_20180328-141607](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8749671/38025860-9e999d30-3292-11e8-96a3-1b9381c2fa7f.png)

### Reproduction

- Open Status and log in to account
- Navigate to `Wallet` -> `Receive transaction` -> `Send a transaction request` 
- In 'Specify recipient' select any contact, in 'Specify amount' specify valid amount (even '0')
- Tap 'Send Request' at the page bottom

### Additional Information
Status version: b33bd65
Operating System: Android and iOS

#### Logs
https://app.testfairy.com/projects/4803622-status/builds/7985879/sessions/39/?accessToken=fmqn9oOZOIDCV7U1LM3Sg60wt6M

This was a bug in develop, fix got merged #3735
